detaileddescription.para: A convenient symbol for the SDMMC peripheral base address

memberdef.name: XMC_SDMMC_CHECK_ACMD_ERR
memberdef.initializer: ((v == XMC_SDMMC_ACMD12_NOT_EXEC_ERR) ||\ (v == XMC_SDMMC_ACMD_TIMEOUT_ERR) ||\ (v == XMC_SDMMC_ACMD_CRC_ERR) ||\ (v == XMC_SDMMC_ACMD_END_BIT_ERR) ||\ (v == XMC_SDMMC_ACMD_IND_ERR) ||\ (v == XMC_SDMMC_CMD_NOT_ISSUED_BY_ACMD12_ERR))

memberdef.name: XMC_SDMMC_CHECK_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER
memberdef.initializer: ((c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_13) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_14) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_15) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_16) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_17) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_18) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_19) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_20) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_21) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_22) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_23) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_24) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_25) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_26) ||\ (c == XMC_SDMMC_DAT_TIMEOUT_COUNTER_2_POW_27))

memberdef.name: XMC_SDMMC_CHECK_SDCLK_FREQ
memberdef.initializer: ((f == XMC_SDMMC_CLK_DIV_1) ||\ (f == XMC_SDMMC_CLK_DIV_2) ||\ (f == XMC_SDMMC_CLK_DIV_4) ||\ (f == XMC_SDMMC_CLK_DIV_8) ||\ (f == XMC_SDMMC_CLK_DIV_16) ||\ (f == XMC_SDMMC_CLK_DIV_32) ||\ (f == XMC_SDMMC_CLK_DIV_64) ||\ (f == XMC_SDMMC_CLK_DIV_128) ||\ (f == XMC_SDMMC_CLK_DIV_256))

detaileddescription.para: CMD12 response errors of Auto CMD12
Used to set the SDMMC card detection status when the card detection status source input is set to software
Response length 48 check Busy after response
Number of data lines for SDMMC data transfer
Valid SD clock frequency divider selection
Status return values for the SDMMC low level driver

SDMMC card write protection signal source
Only available for XMC4300, XMC4800 and XMC4700 series

Used to set the SDMMC card protection status when the card protection status source input is set to software
Only available for XMC4300, XMC4800 and XMC4700 series

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: The function resets the SD_BUS_POWER bit-field in the POWER_CTRL register, disabling the bus power.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: The function sets the SD_BUS_POWER bit-field in the POWER_CTRL register, enabling the bus power. It may be invoked after enabling the SD clock (XMC_SDMMC_SDClockEnable()).

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC event (XMC_SDMMC_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd events

simplesect.para: The function clears requested normal/error events by settings the bit-fields of the INT_STATUS register. Please check SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM in the XMC45000 manual for more details.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: The function asserts the peripheral reset.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Disable delay on the command/data out lines
Use the function to disable delay on the command/data out lines.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC event (XMC_SDMMC_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd events

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Disable normal and error SDMMC event(s)
The function disables the interrupt generation for the requested events by clearing the bit-fields of EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM and EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR registers.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: The XMC_SDMMC_DisableEvent() function doesn't reset the the interrupt status. One may still use XMC_SDMMC_GetEvent() to check the status of requested events even if the interrupt generation is already disabled.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC event (XMC_SDMMC_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd events

simplesect.para: The function resets the bit-fields of EN_INT_STATUS_NORM and EN_INT_STATUS_ERR registers to disable interrupt status for requested normal/error SDMMC events.
Use the function to disable high speed operation. The host controller will switch back to a normal speed mode. In this mode, the host controller outputs command and data lines at 25 MHz for SD.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A pointer to the SDMMC configuration structure (XMC_SDMMC_CONFIG_t)

simplesect.para: The function resets the BLOCK_GAP_CTRL.INT_AT_BLOCK_GAP bit-field to disable interrupt at block gap. This bit is only valid in a 4-bit mode of the SDIO card.

detaileddescription.para:
sdmmc
A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
event
A valid SDMMC wakeup event (XMC_SDMMC_WAKEUP_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd wakeup events
None
Description:
Disable wakeup event(s)
The function disables SDMMC wakeup events by clearing appropriate bit-fields of the WAKEUP_CTRL register.
List of supported wakeup events -> Wakeup on: 1) Card interrupt 2) SD card insertion 3) SD card removal

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: The function de-asserts the peripheral reset. The peripheral needs to be initialized.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Enable delay on the command/data out lines
Use the function to enable delay on the command/data out lines. Invoke this function before selecting the number of delay elements.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC event (XMC_SDMMC_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd events

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Enable SDMMC normal and error event(s)

The function first sets the bit-fields of EN_INT_STATUS_NORM and EN_INT_STATUS_ERR registers to enable interrupt status for requested normal/error SDMMC events. It then sets the bit-fields of EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM and EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR to enable the interrupt generation for the requested events.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC event (XMC_SDMMC_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd events

simplesect.para: The function sets the bit-fields of EN_INT_STATUS_NORM and EN_INT_STATUS_ERR registers to enable interrupt status for requested normal/error SDMMC events.

Use the function to enable high speed operation. The default is a normal speed operation. Once enabled, the host controller outputs command and data lines at the rising edge of the SD clock (up to 50 MHz for SD).

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A pointer to the SDMMC configuration structure (XMC_SDMMC_CONFIG_t)

simplesect.para: The function sets the BLOCK_GAP_CTRL.INT_AT_BLOCK_GAP bit-field to enable interrupt at block gap for a multi-block transfer. This bit is only valid in a 4-bit mode of the SDIO card.

detaileddescription.para:
sdmmc
A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
event
A valid SDMMC wakeup event (XMC_SDMMC_WAKEUP_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd wakeup events
None
Description:
Enable wakeup event(s)
The function enables SDMMC wakeup events by setting appropriate bit-fields of the WAKEUP_CTRL register.
List of supported wakeup events -> Wakeup on: 1) Card interrupt 2) SD card insertion 3) SD card removal

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC ACMD error (XMC_SDMMC_ACMD_ERR_t)

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Get status of Auto CMD12 errors
The function detects the presence of an Auto CMD12 error. A boolean is returned to indicate if an error is detected.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Get card response of Auto commands
This function returns card response [39:8] bits of auto commands: R1 of Auto CMD 23 and R1b of Auto CMD 12.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: Use this function to check the internal SDMMC clock stability. The function returns a boolean value indicating internal clock stability (true = stable)

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: This function returns [39:8] bits of the card response. The others are checked automatically by the peripheral. This function can be used with response type R1, R1b, R3, R4, R5, R5b, R6 but it doesn't support the retrieving of R1 of Auto CMD 23 and R1b of Auto CMD 12. To get these responses, use XMC_SDMMC_GetAutoCommandResponse().

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: The function returns the status of the BLOCK_GAP_CTRL.CONTINUE_REQ bit-field. It returns "true" if the transaction is restarted after a "stop at block gap" request.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC event (XMC_SDMMC_EVENT_t)

simplesect.para: The function returns the status of a single requested (normal/error) event by reading the appropriate bit-fields of the INT_STATUS register.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Get power status of the SDMMC peripheral
The function checks the SD_BUS_POWER bit-field of the POWER_CTRL register and returns a boolean value - "on" or "off".

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: XMC_SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_t A structure storing the present state of the host controller

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Get the present state of the SDMMC host controller

Get the values of each bit-field in SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE register The function call populates an instance of the XMC_SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_t structure with the state of the SD host controller and returns it to the caller.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
Pointer to structure type XMC_SDMMC_RESPONSE_t to store the full response

simplesect.para: The R2 response is 120 bits wide. The function reads all peripheral registers and store in the response data structure.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: The SD host takes some time to reset its registers after invoking XMC_SDMMC_SetSWReset(). Since XMC_SDMMC_SetSWReset() is a non-blocking function, XMC_SDMMC_GetSWResetStatus() has been provided to check the software reset status. The return value needs to be masked with the reset mode (XMC_SDMMC_SW_RESET_t) to get a specific software reset status value.

detaileddescription.para:
sdmmc
A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
uint32_t Number of blocks that need to be transferred
Description:
Get the number of blocks that need to be transferred
This function is valid only for multiple block transfers. The host controller decrements the block count after each block transfer and stops when the count reaches zero. It can only be accessed when no transaction is happening (i.e after a transaction has stopped). This function returns an invalid value during the transfer.
When saving transfer context as a result of the suspend command, the number of blocks yet to be transferred can be determined by using this function.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A pointer to a constant XMC_SDMMC_CONFIG_t structure containing the bus width and clock divider configuration

simplesect.para: The function enables the SDMMC peripheral, sets the internal clock divider register and sets the bus width.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: bool Status of all data lines

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Check if all data line are high

The function reads the SDMMC PRESENT_STATE register and returns "true" if all data lines are high. It can be used to handle SDMMC error conditions. For example, if an error event (XMC_SDMMC_IsAnyErrorEvent()) is detected and all data lines are high, the user code can conclude that the error is of a "recoverable" type.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Check if any error event has occured

The function can typically be used for writing an error interrupt recovery routine. Should any error be indicated (If XMC_SDMMC_IsAnyErrorEvent() returns true), the routine may then clear the event after indicating the error event and reset the SDMMC command and data lines.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Check if the command line is busy

The function reads the SDMMC PRESENT_STATE register and returns "true" if the command line is busy ("false" otherwise). The command line must be free before sending an SDMMC command with XMC_SDMMC_SendCommand().

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Check if the data line is busy

The function reads the SDMMC PRESENT_STATE register and returns "true" if the data line is busy ("false" otherwise). The data line must be free before sending an SDMMC command with XMC_SDMMC_SendCommand().

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: uint32_t The value held in the SDMMC FIFO

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Use this function to read a single word (32 bits) from the SDMMC FIFO.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: The function resets the SDCLOCK_EN bit-field of the CLOCK_CTRL register, disabling the SD clock. It can be used alongside a SD card information reset routine (if required).

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: The function sets the SDCLOCK_EN bit-field of the CLOCK_CTRL register, enabling the SD clock. It can be invoked after the internal clock has achieved stability. SD card initialization process may then follow.

detaileddescription.para:
sdmmc
A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
clk
Desired clock frequency (XMC_SDMMC_SDCLK_FREQ_SEL_t)
None
Description:
Set SD clock frequency
The function sets the CLOCK_CTRL register to configure the frequency of the SD clock pin. The register is programmed with the divisor of the base clock frequency (clk).
The following settings are permitted (8-bit divided clock mode): 00H: base clock (10MHz->63MHz) 01H: base clock divided by 2 10H: base clock divided by 32 02H: base clock divided by 4 04H: base clock divided by 8 08H: base clock divided by 16 20H: base clock divided by 64 40H: base clock divided by 128 80H: base clock divided by 256

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: The internal clock should be disabled before updating frequency clock select. Please see section 2.2.14 -> "Clock Control Register" in the SD HOST specification for more information.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A pointer to a constant of type XMC_SDMMC_COMMAND_t, pointing to the command configuration
Command argument

simplesect.para: Use this function to send a normal SDMMC command. This non-blocking function sets the ARGUMENT1 and COMMAND registers. It is the user's responsibility to check if the command and data lines are busy (XMC_SDMMC_IsDataLineBusy(), XMC_SDMMC_IsCommandLineBusy()).

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
Desired bus voltage (XMC_SDMMC_BUS_VOLTAGE_t)

simplesect.para: The function sets the CLOCK_CTRL register to configure the bus voltage. Currently, 3.3 volts is the supported voltage level. This function is relevant within the host controller initialization routine.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC card detection signal source (XMC_SDMMC_CD_SOURCE_t)
A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC card detection status (XMC_SDMMC_CD_STATUS_t)

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Sets the card detection status indicating whether card is inserted or not. Generates (card ins or card removal) interrupt when the normal interrupt is enabled.
Only valid if SDMMC card detection signal source is set to XMC_SDMMC_CD_SOURCE_SW

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
"true" to restart transaction, "false" is ignored

simplesect.para: The function is used to restart a transaction which was stopped using the "Stop at block gap" request. (XMC_SDMMC_SetStopAtBlockGap())

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
Data line timeout value

simplesect.para: Use the function to set the interval by which the data line timeouts are detected. The timeout clock frequency is generated by dividing the SD clock (TMCLK) by the timeout argument. This function must be called before setting the bus voltage (XMC_SDMMC_SetBusVoltage()).

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
Transfer direction (XMC_SDMMC_DATA_TRANSFER_DIR_t)

simplesect.para: Use the function to set the data transfer direction: host to card OR card to host. It is typically used to configure block operations (read/write) on the SD card. For example, XMC_SDMMC_DATA_TRANSFER_HOST_TO_CARD must be used for a write block operation.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
Transfer mode configuration

simplesect.para: The function configures block size, block count, type of data transfer, response type and sets the auto command configuration. Use this function to configure a multi-block SDMMC transfer.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
Number of data lines to use (XMC_SDMMC_DATA_LINES_t)

simplesect.para: Use the function to set the data transfer width. Before using this function, an ACMD6 command (with R1 response type) must be sent to switch the bus width.

parameterdescription.para: Number of delay elements to select

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Set number of delay elements on the command/data out lines

Use the function to set the number of delay elements on the command/data out lines. The function writes the delay value to the SDMMC delay control register (SDMMCDEL) within the realm of the SCU peripheral. A delay of tapdel + 1 is considered as the final selected number of delay elements.

detaileddescription.para:
sdmmc
A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
enabled
"true" to enable read wait control, "false" to disable read wait control.
None
Description:
Configure read wait control
The read wait function is optional for SDIO cards. If the card supports read wait and XMC_SDMMC_GetTransferBlocksNum() is executed, the SDMMC peripheral will stop read data using DAT[2] line. If this feature is not enabled the peripheral has to stop the SD clock to hold read data, restricting commands generation.
When the host driver detects an SD card insertion, it sets this bit according to the CCCR of the SDIO card. If the card does not support read wait, this feature shall never be enabled otherwise a DAT line conflict may occur. If this feature is disabled, Suspend/Resume cannot be supported.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
"true" to set stop at block gap, "false" for transfer

simplesect.para: The function is used to terminate a transaction execution at the next block gap for non-DMA transfers.

detaileddescription.para:
sdmmc
A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
reset_mode
Reset mode or a bitwise combination of modes
None
Description:
Set SDMMC software reset request
The function sets in the SDMMC SW_RESET register: 1) bit 0 to reset all 2) bit 1 to reset CMD line 3) bit 2 reset DAT line
It is typically used to reset the SD HOST controller's registers.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC card detection signal source (XMC_SDMMC_WP_SOURCE_t)

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Selects input for card write protection status

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC card detection status (XMC_SDMMC_WP_STATUS_t)

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Sets the card write protection status indicating whether card is write protected or not.
Only valid if SDMMC card detection signal source is set to XMC_SDMMC_WP_SOURCE_SW

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: The function enables the internal clock of the SDMMC peripheral. To check if the clock is stable, use XMC_SDMMC_GetClockStability().

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: Invoke XMC_SDMMC_Init() before using this function.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address

simplesect.para: The function disables the internal clock of the SDMMC peripheral. The SDMMC registers can still be read and written even if the internal clock is disabled.

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
A valid SDMMC ACMD error (XMC_SDMMC_ACMD_ERR_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd ACMD error events

simplesect.para: This function triggers Auto CMD12 error(s) by setting appropriate bit-fields of the FORCE_EVENT_ACMD_ERR_STATUS register.

detaileddescription.para:
sdmmc
A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
event
A valid SDMMC event (XMC_SDMMC_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd events
None
Description:
Trigger SDMMC error events
The SDMMC peripheral supports triggering of following error events:
XMC_SDMMC_CMD_TIMEOUT_ERR, XMC_SDMMC_CMD_CRC_ERR, XMC_SDMMC_CMD_END_BIT_ERR, XMC_SDMMC_CMD_IND_ERR, XMC_SDMMC_DATA_TIMEOUT_ERR, XMC_SDMMC_DATA_CRC_ERR, XMC_SDMMC_DATA_END_BIT_ERR, XMC_SDMMC_CURRENT_LIMIT_ERR, XMC_SDMMC_ACMD_ERR, XMC_SDMMC_TARGET_RESP_ERR
For triggering Auto CMD12 error, see XMC_SDMMC_TriggerACMDErr()

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_SDMMC_t, pointing to the SDMMC base address
Pointer to a data word (32 bits) that needs to be written to the FIFO

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Use this function to write a single word (32 bits) to the SDMMC FIFO.
